member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.Aggregates
member.summary: Gets the Grid aggregate rows. Use component to configure aggregate rows.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowExcelExport
member.summary: If AllowExcelExport set to true, then it will allow the user to export grid to Excel file.
member.remarks: To perform excel export, bind event and invoke method in its toolbar item click handler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowFiltering
member.summary: If AllowFiltering set to true the filter bar will be displayed for all columns. If set to false the filter bar will not be displayed. Filter bar allows the user to filter grid records with required criteria.
member.remarks: Filter type can be changed from filterbar using property. Filter can be disabled for particular column by using .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowGrouping
member.summary: If AllowGrouping set to true, then it will allow the user to dynamically group or ungroup columns. Grouping can be done by drag and drop columns from column header to group drop area.
member.remarks: Grouping can be further configured using component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowMultiSorting
member.summary: If AllowMultiSorting set to true, then it will allow the user to sort multiple column in the grid.
member.remarks: must be true to use this property. Sorting can be further configured using component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowPaging
member.summary: If AllowPaging is set to true, the pager renders at the footer of the Grid. It is used to handle page navigation in the Grid.
member.remarks: Paging can be further configured using component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowPdfExport
member.summary: If AllowPdfExport set to true, then it will allow the user to export grid to Pdf file.
member.remarks: To perform pdf export, bind event and invoke method in its toolbar item click handler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowReordering
member.summary: If AllowReordering is set to true, Grid columns can be reordered. Reordering can be done by drag and drop of a particular column from one index to another index.
member.remarks: If Grid is rendered with stacked headers, reordering is allowed only at the same level as the column headers.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowResizing
member.summary: If AllowResizing is set to true, Grid columns can be resized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowRowDragAndDrop
member.summary: If AllowRowDragAndDrop is set to true, you can drag and drop grid rows at another or within grid.
member.remarks: To drag and drop rows between grids or to another component, property should be provided with the ID of the target grid or any other component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowSelection
member.summary: If AllowSelection is set to true, it allows selection of (highlight row) Grid records by clicking it.
member.remarks: Selection can be further configured using component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowSorting
member.summary: If AllowSorting is set to true, it allows sorting of grid records when column header is clicked.
member.remarks: Sorting can be further configured using component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.AllowTextWrap
member.summary: If AllowTextWrap set to true, then text content will wrap to the next line when its text content exceeds the width of the Column Cells.
member.remarks: Text wrap can be further configured using component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ClipMode
member.summary:
Defines the mode of clip. The available modes are,.
Clip Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area.
Ellipsis Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area.
EllipsisWithTooltip Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area also it will display tooltip while hover on ellipsis applied cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ColumnChooserSettings
member.summary: Configures the column chooser in the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.KeySettings
member.summary: Configures the cell movement keys in the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ColumnMenuItems
member.summary:
ColumnMenuItems defines both built-in and custom column menu items.
The available built-in items are, AutoFitAll - Auto fit the size of all columns. AutoFit - Auto fit the current column. Group - Group by current column. Ungroup - Ungroup by current column. SortAscending - Sort the current column in ascending order. SortDescending - Sort the current column in descending order. Filter - Filter options will show based on filterSettings property like checkbox filter, excel filter, menu filter.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ColumnQueryMode
member.summary:
ColumnQueryModeprovides options to retrive data from the datasource.
All It retrives whole data source
Schema Retrives data for all the defined columns in grid from the data source.
ExcludeHidden Retrives data only for visible columns of grid from the data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.Columns
member.summary: Defines the schema of data source. Use to add grid columns. If the Columns declaration is empty or undefined then the columns are automatically generated from data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ContextMenuItems
member.summary:
ContextMenuItems defines both built-in and custom context menu items.
The available built-in items are, AutoFitAll - Auto fit the size of all columns. AutoFit - Auto fit the current column. Group - Group by current column. Ungroup - Ungroup by current column. Edit - Edit the current record. Delete - Delete the current record. Save - Save the edited record. Cancel - Cancel the edited state. Copy - Copy the selected records. PdfExport - Export the grid as Pdf format. ExcelExport - Export the grid as Excel format. CsvExport - Export the grid as CSV format. SortAscending - Sort the current column in ascending order. SortDescending - Sort the current column in descending order. FirstPage - Go to the first page. PrevPage - Go to the previous page. LastPage - Go to the last page. NextPage - Go to the next page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.CurrentAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the current action details.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.DataSource
member.summary: Provides the data source for rendering grid rows. The data source value can be of any type that implements IEnumerable.
member.remarks: To consume data from remote service or custom adaptor, component has to be used.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.DataSourceChanged
member.summary: Invokes when data source changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableAdaptiveUI
member.summary: Render the Grid component as Adaptive mode based on Parent element. Also, it's render's the Grid filter, sorting and editing dialogs adaptively

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EditSettings
member.summary: Configures the edit settings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableAltRow
member.summary: If EnableAltRow is set to true, the grid will render with e-altrow CSS class to the alternative tr elements.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableAutoFill
member.summary: If EnableAutoFill is set to true, then the auto fill icon will displayed on cell selection for copy cells. It requires the selection mode to be Cell and CellSelectionMode to be Box.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableColumnVirtualization
member.summary: If EnableColumnVirtualization set to true, then the Grid will render only the columns visible within the view-port and load subsequent columns on horizontal scrolling. This helps to load large dataset of columns in Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableHeaderFocus
member.summary: If EnableHeaderFocus set to true, then header element will be focused when focus moves to grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableVirtualMaskRow
member.summary: If EnableMastRow set to true the Masked row append in the DOM elements. If set to false default virtual scrolling will work while enabling Enable Virtualization. In this feature Masked cells displayed until data cells retrieve.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableHover
member.summary: If EnableHover is set to true, the row hover is enabled in the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.
member.remarks: Enabling this property will store the grid state such as column order, column width, sort information etc in the window.localStorage when the component is disposed. Users can also store grid state in data base instead of window.localStorage by using method.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.EnableVirtualization
member.summary: If EnableVirtualization set to true, then the Grid will render only the rows visible within the view-port and load subsequent rows on vertical scrolling. This helps to load large dataset in Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.FilterSettings
member.summary: Configures the filter settings of the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.FrozenColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frozen columns.
member.remarks: Specific column can be frozen using property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.FrozenRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frozen rows.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.GridLines
member.summary:
Defines the mode of grid lines. The available modes are,.
Both Displays both the horizontal and vertical grid lines.
None No grid lines are displayed.
Horizontal Displays the horizontal grid lines only.
Vertical Displays grid lines based on the theme.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.GroupSettings
member.summary: Configures the group settings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.Height
member.summary: Defines the scrollable height of the grid content.
member.remarks: Height can be assigned with pixel and percentage values such as 100px, 100% etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.HierarchyPrintMode
member.summary:
Defines the hierarchy grid print modes. The available modes are.
Expanded Prints the master grid with expanded child grids.
All Prints the master grid with all the child grids.
None Prints the master grid alone.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.PageSettings
member.summary: Configures the pager in the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.PrintMode
member.summary:
Defines the print modes. The available print modes are.
AllPages Print all pages records of the Grid.
CurrentPage Print current page records of the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.Query
member.summary: Defines the external Query that will be executed along with data processing.
member.remarks: Additional parameters can be send along with request by using method.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.RowDropSettings
member.summary: Configures the row drop settings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.RowHeight
member.summary: Defines the height of Grid rows.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.RowRenderingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the row rendering mode in grid. Setting this in vertical mode will render rows vertically with headers in the same row which suits better to use grid in small screens. In vertical row rendering mode, limited features are supported like filtering,sorting, Dialog editing, Selection, Searching and Row virtualization.

member.summary: Configures the search behavior in the Grid.

member.summary: The SelectedRowIndex allows you to select a row at initial rendering.

member.summary: Configures the selection settings.

member.summary: If ShowColumnChooser is set to true, it allows you to dynamically show or hide columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.ShowColumnMenu
member.summary: If ShowColumnMenu set to true, then it will enable the column menu options in each columns.

member.summary: Configures the sort settings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.Toolbar
member.summary: Toolbar defines the ToolBar items of the Grid. It contains built-in and custom toolbar items.
member.remarks: If an array value is assigned, it is considered as the list of built-in and custom toolbar items in the Grid's Toolbar. In some cases user may want to use custom toolbar instead of custom item, in such cases user can use property to provide custom toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Grids.SfGrid`1.Width
member.summary: Defines the Grid width.
member.remarks: Width can be assigned with pixel and percentage values such as 100px, 100% etc. When the sum of total column width exceeds this value then the browser horizontal scrollbar will be displayed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.Internal.SfInputBase.Autocomplete
member.summary:
Specifies whether the browser is allowed to automatically enter or select a value for the TextBox.
By default, autocomplete is enabled for TextBox.
Possible values are:
On Specifies that autocomplete is enabled
Off Specifies that autocomplete is disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.Internal.SfInputBase.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the TextBox. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a TextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.Internal.SfInputBase.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable the persisting TextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.Internal.SfInputBase.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.Internal.SfInputBase.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the TextBox allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.Internal.SfInputBase.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the TextBox that the placeholder text floats above the TextBox based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the TextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfInputTextBase`1.BaseFloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the TextBox that the placeholder text floats above the TextBox based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the TextBox.
Auto The floating label floats above the TextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfInputTextBase`1.ValidateOnInput
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component validates the input or not.
member.value: true, If the ValidateOnInput is enabled for form validation, then the model value will be updated on entering the value to the input. otherwise, false.The default value is false.
member.remarks: This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel
member.summary: Interface for a class AsyncSettings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.ChunkSize
member.summary:
Specifies the chunk size to split the large file into chunks, and upload it to the server in a sequential order.
If the ChunkSize property has value, the Uploader enables the chunk upload by default.
It must be specified in bytes value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.RemoveUrl
member.summary:
Specifies the URL of remove action that receives the file information and handle the remove operation in server.
The remove action type must be POST request and define "RemoveFileNames" attribute to get file information that will be removed.
This property is optional.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.RetryAfterDelay
member.summary: Specifies the delay time in milliseconds that the automatic retry happens after the delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.RetryCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries that the Uploader can perform on the file failed to upload. By default, the Uploader set 3 as maximum retries. This property must be specified to prevent infinity looping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.SaveUrl
member.summary:
Specifies the URL of save action that will receive the upload files and save in the server.
The save action type must be POST request and define the argument as same input name used to render the component.
The upload operations could not perform without this property.

member.summary: Fires when the chunk file uploaded successfully.

member.summary: Fires if pause the chunk file uploading.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Progress
member.summary: Triggers when uploading a file to the server using the AJAX request.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Removing
member.summary: Triggers on removing the uploaded file. The event used to get confirm before removing the file from server.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Rendering
member.summary: DEPRECATED-Triggers before rendering each file item from the file list in a page. It helps to customize specific file item structure.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Resuming
member.summary: Fires if resume the paused chunk file upload.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Selected
member.summary: Triggers after selecting or dropping the files by adding the files in upload queue.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Success
member.summary: Triggers when the AJAX request gets success on uploading files or removing files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Uploading
member.summary: Triggers when the upload process gets started. This event is used to add additional parameter with upload request.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.AllowedExtensions
member.summary:
Specifies the extensions of the file types allowed in the Uploader component and pass the extensions with comma separators.
For example,if you want to upload specific image files, pass `AllowedExtensions` as ".jpg,.png".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.AsyncSettings
member.summary: Configures the save and remove URL to perform the upload operations in the server asynchronously.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.AutoUpload
member.summary:
By default, the Uploader component initiates automatic upload when the files are added in upload queue.
If you want to manipulate the files before uploading to server, disable the AutoUpload property.
The buttons "upload" and "clear" will be hided from file list when AutoUpload property is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Buttons
member.summary:
You can customize the default text of "browse, clear, and upload" buttons with plain text or HTML elements. The buttons' text can be customized from localization also.
If you configured both `Locale` and `Buttons` property,the Uploader component considers the `Buttons` property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the Uploader. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a Uploader.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.DirectoryUpload
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the folder of files can be browsed in the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.DropArea
member.summary: Specifies the drop target to handle the drag-and-drop upload. By default, the Uploader creates wrapper around file input that will act as drop target.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.DropEffect
member.summary:
Specifies the drag operation effect to the Uploader component.
Possible values are.
Copy
Move
Link
None

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting Uploader state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Files` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering Uploader in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the Uploader allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Files
member.summary:
Specifies the list of files that will be preloaded on rendering of Uploader component. The property used to view and remove the uploaded files from server.
By default, the files are configured with uploaded successfully state. The following properties are mandatory to configure the preload files:
Name
Size
Type

summary.para: You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the Uploader considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.MaxFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum allowed file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload too large files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.MinFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload empty files and small files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Multiple
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the multiple files can be browsed or dropped simultaneously in the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.SequentialUpload
member.summary:
By default, the file Uploader component is processing the multiple files simultaneously.
If SequentialUpload property is enabled, the file upload component performs the upload one after the other.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.ShowFileList
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the default file list can be rendered. The property used to prevent default file list and design own template for file list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML string that used to customize the content of each file in the list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfMaskedTextBox.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the SfMaskedTextBox that the placeholder text floats above the SfMaskedTextBox based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the SfMaskedTextBox when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the SfMaskedTextBox.
Auto The floating label floats above the SfMaskedTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.summary:
Sets the collection of values to be mapped for non-mask elements(literals) which have been set in the mask of MaskedTextBox.
In the below example, non-mask elements "P" accepts values "P" , "A" , "p" , "a" and "M" accepts values "M", "m" mentioned in the custom characters collection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.NumericTextBoxModel`1.StrictMode
member.summary:
Specifies a value that indicates whether the NumericTextBox component allows the value for the specified range.
True- the input value will be restricted between the min and max range. The typed value gets modified to fit the range on a focused out state.
Else, it allows any value even out of range value, at that time of wrong value entered, the error class will be added to the component to highlight the error.

members.member:
Partial class SfSlider.
Generic type parameter..
Partial class SfSlider.
Specifies the partial class SfSlider.
Specifies the partial class SfSlider.
The Slider component allows the user to select a value or range of values in-between the min and max range, by dragging the handle over the slider bar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSlider`1.Type
member.summary: Defines the type of the Slider. The available options are: Default - Allows to a single value in the Slider. MinRange - Allows to select a single value in the Slider. It displays a shadow from the start to the current value. Range - Allows to select a range of values in the Slider. It displays shadow in-between the selection range.

member.summary: It is used to denote the position for the tooltip element in the Slider. The available options are: Before - Tooltip is shown in the top of the horizontal slider bar or at the left of the vertical slider bar. After - Tooltip is shown in the bottom of the horizontal slider bar or at the right of the vertical slider bar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel
member.summary: Interface for a class TextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.Autocomplete
member.summary:
Specifies whether the browser is allowed to automatically enter or select a value for the TextBox.
By default, autocomplete is enabled for TextBox.
Possible values are:
On Specifies that autocomplete is enabled
Off Specifies that autocomplete is disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the TextBox. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a TextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable the persisting TextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the TextBox allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the TextBox that the placeholder text floats above the TextBox based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the TextBox.
Auto The floating label floats above the TextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.HtmlAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.InputAttributes
member.summary:

If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.

The TextBox changes from a single line to multiline when enabling this multiline mode.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader
member.summary: The uploader component is useful to upload images, documents, and other files to server. The component is the extended version of HTML5 that is uploaded with multiple file selection, auto upload, drag and drop, progress bar, preload files, and validation.
Specifies the list of files that will be preloaded on rendering of uploader component.
Specifies the list of files that will be preloaded on rendering of uploader component.

The uploader component is useful to upload images, documents, and other files to server. The component is the extended version of HTML5 that is uploaded with multiple file selection, auto upload, drag and drop, progress bar, preload files, and validation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.ID
member.summary: Specifies the id of the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.ChildContent
member.summary: Specifies the content that has to be passed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.AllowedExtensions
member.summary:
Specifies the extensions of the file types allowed in the Uploader component and pass the extensions with comma separators.
For example,if you want to upload specific image files, pass `AllowedExtensions` as ".jpg,.png".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.AsyncSettings
member.summary: Configures the save and remove URL to perform the upload operations in the server asynchronously.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.AutoUpload
member.summary:
By default, the Uploader component initiates automatic upload when the files are added in upload queue.
If you want to manipulate the files before uploading to server, disable the AutoUpload property.
The buttons "upload" and "clear" will be hided from file list when AutoUpload property is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Buttons
member.summary:
You can customize the default text of "browse, clear, and upload" buttons with plain text or HTML elements. The buttons' text can be customized from localization also.
If you configured both Locale and Buttons property,the Uploader component considers the Buttons property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the Uploader. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a Uploader.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.DirectoryUpload
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the folder of files can be browsed in the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.DropArea
member.summary: Specifies the drop target to handle the drag-and-drop upload. By default, the Uploader creates wrapper around file input that will act as drop target.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.DropEffect
member.summary:
Specifies the drag operation effect to the Uploader component.
Possible values are .
Copy
Move
Link
None

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting Uploader state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Files` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering Uploader in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the Uploader allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Files
member.summary:
Specifies the list of files that will be preloaded on rendering of Uploader component. The property used to view and remove the uploaded files from server.
By default, the files are configured with uploaded successfully state. The following properties are mandatory to configure the preload files:
Name
Size
Type

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.SequentialUpload

If SequentialUpload property is enabled, the file upload component performs the upload one after the other.

Set true if files remove without removing event.
Set false, to post file name only to the remove action.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings
member.summary: Specifies the Uploader Events of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Specifies the content that has to be passed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.ChunkSize
member.summary:
Specifies the ChunkSize to split the large file into chunks, and upload it to the server in a sequential order.
If the ChunkSize property has value, the Uploader enables the chunk upload by default. It must be specified in bytes value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RemoveUrl
member.summary:
Specifies the URL of remove action that receives the file information and handle the remove operation in server.
The remove action type must be POST request and define "RemoveFileNames" attribute to get file information that will be removed. This property is optional.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryAfterDelay
member.summary: Specifies the delay time in milliseconds that the automatic retry happens after the delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries that the Uploader can perform on the file failed to upload. By default, the Uploader set 3 as maximum retries. This property must be specified to prevent infinity looping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.SaveUrl
member.summary:
Specifies the URL of save action that will receive the upload files and save in the server.
The save action type must be POST request and define the argument as same input name used to render the component. The upload operations could not perform without this property.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.OnInitializedAsync
member.summary: Triggers while initial rendering of the component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.OnParametersSetAsync
member.summary: Triggers after the component was rendered.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout
member.summary: Specifies the DashboardLayout component.
Specifies the DashboardLayout component.
Specifies the DashboardLayout component.

The DashboardLayout is a grid structured layout component, that helps to create a dashboard with panels. Panels hold the UI components or data to be visualized with flexible options like resize, reorder, drag-n-drop, remove and add, that allows users to easily place the panels at a desired position within the grid layout.

member.summary: Specifies the height of the Splitter component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.Orientation
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether to align the split panes horizontally or vertically. Set the orientation property as "Horizontal" to create a horizontal splitter that aligns the panes left-to-right. Set the orientation property as "Vertical" to create a vertical splitter that aligns the panes top-to-bottom.

member.summary: Specifies the width of the Splitter component. The value can be either in pixel or percentage format.

member.summary: Specifies the minimum size of a pane. The pane cannot be resized less than the specified minimum size.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.PanePropertiesModel.Resizable
member.summary: Specifies the value whether a pane is resizable or not. By default, the Splitter panes are resizable. You can disable resize functionality for any specific panes using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.PanePropertiesModel.Size

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1
member.summary: Component for executing complex list items common functionalities.
Configure member properties of the ListView component.

The SfListView control represents the data in interactive hierarchical structure interface across different layouts or views, that also has features such as data-binding, template, grouping and virtualization.

The SfListView control represents the data in interactive hierarchical structure interface across different layouts or views, that also has features such as data-binding, template, grouping and virtualization.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbItem
member.summary: A class that represents breadcrumb component item of component.
member.remarks: You can render icon only, text only, icon and text breadcrumb item by specifying value to corresponding property. Additional attributes can be added to Breadcrumb item using @attributes directive.
member.example:
In the below code example, a basic Breadcrumb item has been added using tag directive.
<SfBreadcrumb> <BreadcrumbItems> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Home" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Components" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/datagrid/overview"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Navigations" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/menu-bar/default-functionalities"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Breadcrumb" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/breadcrumb/default-functionalities"></BreadcrumbItem> </BreadcrumbItems> </SfBreadcrumb>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbItem.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the child content for the Breadcrumb item. If the child content is not specified breadcrumb item is rendered using content.
member.value: The template content. The default value in null.
member.example: In the below code example, content has been set to using property and property. Components

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbItem.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text content of the Breadcrumb item.
member.value: Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: Set child content within tag directive, to render as HTML content.
member.example: In the below code example, content has been set to using property and ChildContent property. Home Components

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbItem.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets the Url of the Breadcrumb item and that will be navigated when clicked.
member.value: Accepts Url string value. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: When Url has not been set, you can customize the item navigation using event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbItem.IconCss
member.summary: Gets or sets a CSS class string to include an icon or image for the breadcrumb item.
member.value: Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the breadcrumb item. The default value is String.Empty.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbItem.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes that will be applied to the breadcrumb item element.
member.remarks: Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive.
member.example:
In the below code example, title attribute added as inline in tag directive.
<SfBreadcrumb> <BreadcrumbItems> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Home" title="Home"></BreadcrumbItem> </BreadcrumbItems> </SfBreadcrumb>

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbItems
member.summary: Represents a collection of .
member.remarks: To generate dynamic based on collection, use @foreach within tag directive.
member.example:
In the below code example, a basic Breadcrumb has been rendered using tag directive.
<SfBreadcrumb> <BreadcrumbItems> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Home"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Components"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Navigations"></BreadcrumbItem> </BreadcrumbItems> </SfBreadcrumb>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbItems.ChildContent
member.summary: Specifies the child content for the Breadcrumb items.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbTemplates
member.summary: Represents template options in component.
member.remarks: or can be set tag directive. To access template's context parameter use @context in both and .
member.example: In the below code example, both and has been specified. @context.Text

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbTemplates.ItemTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets template as , that defines custom appearance of breadcrumb items. Here, context refers to the for which the template is applied.
member.value: A template content that specifies the visualization of breadcrumb items. The default value in null.
member.remarks: The ItemTemplate used to define appearance of breadcrumb items. Use the templates context parameter to access the properties. Specify within tag directive.
member.example: In the below code example, italic style Breadcrumb item text has been rendered using ItemTemplate. @context.Text

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbTemplates.SeparatorTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets template as , that defines custom appearance of breadcrumb items separator. Here, context refers to the for previous and current item which the template is applied.
member.value: A template content that specifies the visualization of breadcrumb items separator. The default value in null.
member.remarks: The SeparatorTemplate used to define appearance of breadcrumb items separator. Use the templates context parameter to access the previous and current properties. Specify within tag directive.
member.example: In the below code example, caret icon is rendered as Breadcrumb items separator using SeparatorTemplate.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbOverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies how to display breadcrumb items in component when the Breadcrumb items exceeds Breadcrumb container or property.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbOverflowMode.Default
member.summary: The specified count will be visible and the remaining items will be hidden. While clicking on the previous item, the hidden item will become visible.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.BreadcrumbOverflowMode.Collapsed
member.summary: Only the first and last items will be visible, and the remaining items will be hidden with collapsed icon. When the collapsed icon is clicked, all items become visible and scroll will be enabled if the space is not enough to show all items.

member.summary: Provides information about the event callback.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb
member.summary: Breadcrumb component is a graphical user interface that helps to identify or highlight the current location within a hierarchical structure of websites. The aim is to make the user aware of their current position in a hierarchy of website links.
member.remarks: Breadcrumb items can be populated either by specifying property or by specifying within tag directive. and can be used to customize the Breadcrumb component UI using tag directive.
member.example:
In the below code example, a basic Breadcrumb component initialized with tag directive.
<SfBreadcrumb> <BreadcrumbItems> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Home" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Components" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/datagrid/overview"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Navigations" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/menu-bar/default-functionalities"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Breadcrumb" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/breadcrumb/default-functionalities"></BreadcrumbItem> </BreadcrumbItems> </SfBreadcrumb>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets the Url based on which the Breadcrumb items are generated.
member.value: The value as a Url string to generate Breadcrumb items. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: You can specify only absolute Url to this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.Items
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of breadcrumb items that will be populated using the tag directive.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.ActiveItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the of the active breadcrumb item.
member.value: This property contains Url string of active breadcrumb item.
member.remarks: This property is updated only when the has value.

example.code:
<SfBreadcrumb>
                <BreadcrumbItems ActiveItem="@activeItem">
                    <BreadcrumbItem Text="Home" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/"></BreadcrumbItem>
                    <BreadcrumbItem Text="Components" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/datagrid/overview"></BreadcrumbItem>
                    <BreadcrumbItem Text="Navigations" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/menu-bar/default-functionalities"></BreadcrumbItem>
                    <BreadcrumbItem Text="Breadcrumb" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/breadcrumb/default-functionalities"></BreadcrumbItem>
                </BreadcrumbItems>
            </SfBreadcrumb>
            @code {
                private string activeItem = "https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/menu-bar/default-functionalities";
            }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.MaxItems
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of breadcrumb items to be visible in the breadcrumb component. If the number of items exceeds this count, then items are rendered based on property.
member.value: The number of breadcrumb items to be visible in breadcrumb component. The default value is 0.
member.remarks: The is applicable only if the number of is greater than 2.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.OverflowMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display breadcrumb items when the breadcrumb items count exceeds .
member.value: One of the enumeration. The default value is
member.remarks: If the OverflowMode is Default, the exceeded items will be hidden and while clicking on the previous item, the hidden item will become visible. If the OverflowMode is Collapsed, only the first and last items will be visible, and the remaining items will be hidden with collapsed icon. When the collapsed icon is clicked, all items become visible and scroll will be enabled if the space is not enough to show all items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width for the Breadcrumb component container element. If the Breadcrumb items overflows the container width, the browser scrollbar will be activated.
member.value: It contains component width in pixel or percentage. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: If the property is specified, the property will be prioritized than Breadcrumb container width and responsive UI will be activated based on . You can set container width using CSS and HTML style attribute using @attributes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.EnableNavigation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the built-in item navigation is enabled or not. The breadcrumb component navigates to url based on the item clicked by user.
member.value: true, if built-in item navigation is enabled; otherwise, false.The default value is true.
member.remarks: You can handle navigation in using event by setting as false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.EnableActiveItemNavigation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the navigation is enabled for active item (last breadcrumb item).
member.value: true, if the navigation is enabled for last breadcrumb item and it is clickable. otherwise, false.The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to true, the property is persisted.
member.value: true, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Component's property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfBreadcrumb.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes that will applied to the Breadcrumb container element.
member.remarks: Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive.
member.example:
In the below code example, Breadcrumb width has been specified as style attribute in tag directive.
<SfBreadcrumb style="width:200px"> <BreadcrumbItems> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Home" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Components" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/datagrid/overview"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Navigations" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/menu-bar/default-functionalities"></BreadcrumbItem> <BreadcrumbItem Text="Breadcrumb" Url="https://blazor.syncfusion.com/demos/breadcrumb/default-functionalities"></BreadcrumbItem> </BreadcrumbItems> </SfBreadcrumb>

member.summary: Allows to place the sidebar inside the target element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfSidebar.Type
member.summary: Specifies the expanding types of the Sidebar. `Over` - The sidebar floats over the main content area. `Push` - The sidebar pushes the main content area to appear side-by-side and shrinks the main content within the screen width. `Slide` - The sidebar translates the x and y positions of the main content area based on the sidebar width. The main content area will not be adjusted within the screen width. `Auto` - Sidebar with `Over` type in mobile resolution and `Push` type in other higher resolutions.

member.summary: Indicates whether the Tab allows drag and drop over tab items. Tab item has been reordered based on the dropped item.

member.summary: Defines the area in which the draggable element movement will be occurring. Outside that area will be restricted for the draggable element movement. By default, the draggable element movement occurs with Tabitems.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left (RTL) direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.HeaderPlacement
member.summary: Specifies the orientation of the Tab header. The possible values are: - Top: Places the Tab header on the top. - Bottom: Places the Tab header at the bottom. - Left: Places the Tab header at the left. - Right: Places the Tab header at the right.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the Tabs component. By default, Tab height is set based on the height of its parent.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.LoadOn
member.summary: Specifies the modes for the Tab content. The possible modes are: `Dynamic` Load the Tab content dynamically, which is rendering its content when switching its header. `Init` Loads all the tab contents on initial loading. `Demand` Loads the Tab content when required but keeps the content once it is rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the display mode which will be applied when the Tabs exceeds the viewing area. The possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements will be displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Tab container will hold the items that can be placed within the available space and the rest of the items will be moved to the popup.

member.summary: Event triggers when `click` the toolbar item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Align
member.summary: Specifies the location for aligning Toolbar items on the Toolbar. Each command will be aligned according to the `Align` property. Possible values are: - Left: To align commands to the left side of the Toolbar. - Center: To align commands at the center of the Toolbar. - Right: To align commands to the right side of the Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.CssClass
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes (separated by space) to be used for customization of commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies whether an item should be disabled or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Defines htmlAttributes used to add custom attributes to Toolbar command. Supports HTML attributes such as style, class, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Id
member.summary: Specifies the unique ID to be used with button or input element of Toolbar items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Overflow
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar command display area when an element's content is too large to fit available space. This is applicable only to `Popup` mode. Possible values are: - Show: Always shows the item as the primary priority on the Toolbar. - Hide: Always shows the item as the secondary priority on the popup. - None: No priority for display, and as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.PrefixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned before the text content if text is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.ShowAlwaysInPopup
member.summary: Defines the priority of items to display it in popup always. It allows to maintain toolbar item on popup always but it does not work for toolbar priority items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.ShowTextOn
member.summary: Specifies where the button text will be displayed on popup mode of the Toolbar. Possible values are: - Toolbar: Text will be displayed on Toolbar only. - Overflow: Text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup. - Both: Text will be displayed on popup and Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.SuffixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned after the text content if text is available.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Template
member.summary: Specifies the template that can be added as a Toolbar command.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Text
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.TooltipText
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on hovering the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Type
member.summary: Specifies the types of command to be rendered in the Toolbar. Supported types are: - Button: Creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc. - Separator: Adds a horizontal line that separates the Toolbar commands. - Input: Creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Visible
member.summary: Specifies whether an item should be hidden or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toolbar button commands.

member.summary: Sets ID attribute for toolbar element.

member.summary: Child Content for Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.AllowKeyboard
member.summary: When this property is set to true, it allows the keyboard interaction in toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.CssClass
member.summary: Sets the CSS classes to root element of the Toolbar that helps to customize component styles.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.EnableCollision
member.summary: Enable or disable the popup collision.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the Toolbar in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.Items
member.summary: A list of items that is used to configure Toolbar commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar display mode when Toolbar content exceeds the viewing area. Possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements are displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Prioritized elements are displayed on the Toolbar and the rest of elements are moved to the popup. - MultiRow: Displays the overflow toolbar items as an in-line of a toolbar. - Extended: Hide the overflowing toolbar items in the next row. Show the overflowing toolbar items when you click the expand icons. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements will be hidden.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.ScrollStep
member.summary: Specifies the scrolling distance in scroller.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toolbar in pixels/numbers/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as id, title etc., to the toolbar element.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.AddItems(System.Collections.Generic.List{Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem},System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds new items to the Toolbar that accepts an list of Toolbar items.
member.param: A list of items to be added to the Toolbar.
Number value that determines where the command is to be added.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.RemoveItems(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the items from the Toolbar at the specified index.
member.param: Index of item which is to be removed from the Toolbar.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.EnableItems(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Enables or disables the specified Toolbar item.
member.param: A list of toolbar item index to be enabled or disabled.
Boolean value that determines whether the command should be enabled or disabled. By default, `isEnable` is set to true.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.HideItem(System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Shows or hides the Toolbar item that is in the specified index.
member.param: Index value of target item to be hidden or shown.
Based on this Boolean value, item will be hide (true) or show (false). By default, isHide is false.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.HideItemAsync(System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Shows or hides the Toolbar item that is in the specified index.
member.param: Index value of target item to be hidden or shown.
Based on this Boolean value, item will be hide (true) or show (false). By default, isHide is false.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.Disable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies the value to disable/enable the Toolbar component. When set to `True`, the component will be disabled.

member.summary: Specifies the value to disable/enable the Toolbar component. When set to `True`, the component will be disabled.
member.param: Based on this Boolean value, Toolbar will be enabled (false) or disabled (true).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.RefreshOverflow
member.summary: Refresh the whole Toolbar component without re-rendering. - It is used to manually refresh the Toolbar overflow modes such as scrollable, popup, multi row, and extended. - It will refresh the Toolbar component after loading items dynamically.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.RefreshOverflowAsync
member.summary: Refresh the whole Toolbar component without re-rendering. - It is used to manually refresh the Toolbar overflow modes such as scrollable, popup, multi row, and extended. - It will refresh the Toolbar component after loading items dynamically.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.Refresh
member.summary: Applies all the pending property changes and render the component again.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.RefreshAsync
member.summary: Applies all the pending property changes and render the component again.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the options of Toolbar display mode. Display option is considered when Toolbar content exceeds the available space.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode.Scrollable
member.summary: Scrollable - All the elements are displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode.Popup
member.summary: Popup - Prioritized elements are displayed on the Toolbar and the rest of elements are moved to the popup.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode.MultiRow
member.summary: MultiRow - Displays the overflow toolbar items as an in-line of a toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowMode.Extended
member.summary: Extended - Hide the overflowing toolbar items in the next row. Show the overflowing toolbar items when you click the expand icons. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements will be hidden.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode
member.summary: Specifies the options of where the text will be displayed in popup mode of the Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode.Both
member.summary: Both - Text will be displayed on popup and Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode.Overflow
member.summary: Overflow - Text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DisplayMode.Toolbar
member.summary: Toolbar - Text will be displayed on Toolbar only.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign
member.summary: Specifies the options for aligning the Toolbar items.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign.Left
member.summary: Left - To align commands to the left side of the Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign.Center
member.summary: Center - To align commands at the center of the Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemAlign.Right
member.summary: Right - To align commands to the right side of the Toolbar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType
member.summary: Specifies the options for supporting element types of Toolbar command.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType.Button
member.summary: Button - Creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType.Separator
member.summary: Separator - Adds a horizontal line that separates the Toolbar commands.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemType.Input
member.summary: Input - Creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption
member.summary: Specifies the options of the Toolbar item display area when the Toolbar content overflows to available space.Applicable to `Popup` mode.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption.None
member.summary: None - No priority for display, and as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption.Show
member.summary: Show - Always shows the item as the primary priority on the Toolbar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.OverflowOption.Hide
member.summary: Hide - Always shows the item as the secondary priority on the popup.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem
member.summary: An item object that is used to configure Toolbar commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ChildContent
member.summary: Child Content for Toolbar item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.OnClick
member.summary: Event triggers when click the toolbar item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Align
member.summary: Specifies the location for aligning Toolbar items on the Toolbar. Each command will be aligned according to the `Align` property. Possible values are: - Left: To align commands to the left side of the Toolbar. - Center: To align commands at the center of the Toolbar. - Right: To align commands to the right side of the Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.CssClass
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes (separated by space) to be used for customization of commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies whether an item should be disabled or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Defines htmlAttributes used to add custom attributes to Toolbar command. Supports HTML attributes such as style, class, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Id
member.summary: Specifies the unique ID to be used with button or input element of Toolbar items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Overflow
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar command display area when an element's content is too large to fit available space. This is applicable only to `Popup` mode. Possible values are: - Show: Always shows the item as the primary priority on the Toolbar. - Hide: Always shows the item as the secondary priority on the popup. - None: No priority for display, and as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.PrefixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned before the text content if text is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowAlwaysInPopup
member.summary: Defines the priority of items to display it in popup always. It allows to maintain toolbar item on popup always but it does not work for toolbar priority items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowTextOn
member.summary: Specifies where the button text will be displayed on popup mode of the Toolbar. Possible values are: - Toolbar: Text will be displayed on Toolbar only. - Overflow: Text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup. - Both: Text will be displayed on popup and Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.SuffixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned after the text content if text is available.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML element/element ID as a string that can be added as a Toolbar command.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Text
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.TooltipText
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on hovering the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Type
member.summary: Specifies the types of command to be rendered in the Toolbar. Supported types are: - Button: Creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc. - Separator: Adds a horizontal line that separates the Toolbar commands. - Input: Creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Visible
member.summary: Specifies whether an item should be hidden or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toolbar button commands.

member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Method invoked when the component has received parameters from its parent in the render tree, and the incoming values have been assigned to properties.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1
member.summary: Specifies the TreeView component.
Specifies the TreeView component.
SfTreeView component.

The TreeView component is used to represent hierarchical data in a tree like structure with advanced functions to edit, drag and drop, select with CheckBox and more. TreeView can be populated from a data source such as an array of data's or from DataManager.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.OnInitializedAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.OnAfterRenderAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method invoked after each time the component has been rendered.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.OnParametersSetAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when any changes in component state occurs.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ChildContent
member.summary: Get the RenderFragment content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: Indicates whether the TreeView allows drag and drop of nodes. To drag and drop a node in desktop, hold the mouse on the node, drag it to the target node and drop the node by releasing the mouse. For touch devices, drag and drop operation is performed by touch, touch move and touch end.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowEditing
member.summary: Enables or disables editing of the text in the TreeView node. When `AllowEditing` property is set to true, the TreeView allows you to edit the node by double clicking the node or by navigating to the node and pressing F2 key.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowMultiSelection
member.summary: Enables or disables multi-selection of nodes. To select multiple nodes: Select the nodes by holding down the CTRL key while clicking on the nodes. Select consecutive nodes by clicking the first node to select and hold down the SHIFT key and click the last node to select.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowTextWrap
member.summary: Enables or disables to wrap the text in the TreeView node. When the `AllowTextWrap` property is set to true, the TreeView node text content will wrap to the next line when its text content exceeds the width of the TreeView node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.Animation
member.summary: Specifies the type of animation applied on expanding and collapsing the nodes along with duration.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AutoCheck
member.summary: Allow us to specify the parent and child nodes to get auto check while we check or uncheck a node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.CheckedNodes
member.summary: The `CheckedNodes` property is used to set the nodes that need to be checked or get the ID of nodes that are currently checked in the TreeView component. The `checkedNodes` property depends upon the value of `showCheckBox` property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.CheckedNodesChanged
member.summary: Specifies the callback to trigger when the checked nodes changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS classes to be added with root element of the TreeView to help customize the appearance of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the TreeView component is disabled or not. When set to true, user interaction will not be occurred in TreeView.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.DropArea
member.summary: Defines the area in which the draggable element movement will be occurring. Outside that area will be restricted for the draggable element movement. By default, the draggable element movement occurs in the entire page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.EnableHtmlSanitizer
member.summary: Defines whether to allow the cross-scripting site or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enables or disables persisting TreeView state between page reloads. If enabled, following APIs will persist. 1. `SelectedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are selected in the TreeView component. 2. `checkedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are checked in the TreeView component. 3. `expandedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are expanded in the TreeView component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ExpandOn
member.summary: Specifies the action on which the node expands or collapses. The available actions are, `Click` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you single-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `DblClick` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `None` - The expand/collapse operation will not happen when you single-click or double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ExpandedNodes
member.summary: Represents the expanded nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be expanded or get the ID of the nodes that are currently expanded by using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ExpandedNodesChanged
member.summary: Specifies the callback to trigger when the expanded nodes changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.Fields
member.summary: Specifies the data source and mapping fields to render TreeView nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.FullRowNavigable
member.summary: If this property is set to true, then the entire TreeView node will be navigate-able instead of text element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.FullRowSelect
member.summary: On enabling this property, the entire row of the TreeView node gets selected by clicking a node. When disabled only the corresponding node's text gets selected.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.LoadOnDemand
member.summary: By default, the load on demand (Lazy load) is set to true. By disabling this property, all the tree nodes are rendered at the beginning itself.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.SelectedNodes
member.summary: Represents the selected nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be selected or get the ID of the nodes that are currently selected by using this property. On enabling `AllowMultiSelection` property we can select multiple nodes and on disabling it we can select only a single node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.SelectedNodesChanged
member.summary: Specifies the callback to trigger when the selected nodes changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ShowCheckBox
member.summary: Indicates that the nodes will display CheckBoxes in the TreeView. The CheckBox will be displayed next to the expand/collapse icon of the node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.SortOrder
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the nodes are sorted in the ascending or descending order, or are not sorted at all. The available types of sort order are, `None` - The nodes are not sorted. `Ascending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order. `Descending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Specify the HtmlAttributes for TreeView.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.TreeViewTemplates
member.summary: Specifies the custom item template of TreeView Node item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ID
member.summary: Sets id attribute for the treeview element.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.UpdateAnimationProperties(Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewNodeAnimationSettings)
member.summary: Specifies the Animation properties.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AddNodes(System.Collections.Generic.List{`0},System.String)
member.summary: Adds the collection of TreeView nodes based on target and index position. If target node is not specified, then the nodes are added as children of the given parentID or in the root level of TreeView.
member.param: A list of nodes to be added to the TreeView.
Based on target nodes are added as children of the given parentID or in the root level of TreeView.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.BeginEdit(System.String)
member.summary: Instead of clicking on the TreeView node for editing, we can enable it by using `BeginEdit` property. On passing the node ID or element through this property, the edit textBox will be created for the particular node thus allowing us to edit it.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.GetTreeData(System.String)
member.summary: To get the updated data source of TreeView after performing some operation like drag and drop, node editing, node selecting/unSelecting, node expanding/collapsing, node checking/unChecking, adding and removing node. If you pass the ID of TreeView node as arguments for this method then it will return the updated data source of the corresponding node otherwise it will return the entire updated data source of TreeView. The updated data source also contains custom attributes if you specified in data source.
